sub_title: Building @bricknic - A brand that creates cooking tools for togetherness.
summary:
Hi, I'm Timm Donke, Inventor, Ceo and Co-founder of Bricknic®, a brand specializing in developing, producing, and marketing cooking tools for togetherness. With a background in Design and a focus on social entrepreneurship, I have worked with organizations such as Hivos, Cultureland, and the Landcooperatie Dal van de Kleine Beerze on numerous projects. I'm also a member of the Design Networking Hub at the German Design Council. As a Cum Laude graduate of the Design Academy Eindhoven, I bring a wealth of experience and passion to my work. I'm excited to connect and share ideas with like-minded professionals.

Visit Bricknic —> https://linktr.ee/bricknic

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Arts - BA , Cum Laude

awards.title: Die Gute Form 2015
awards.description: First price for design award Die Gute Form Hessen. Nominee for design award Die Gute Form Germany.

profile_positions.description:
- At Bricknic, we specialise in creating tools that allow people to celebrate delicious food and good times through collaborative cooking.
- I invented and co-founded Bricknic in 2018, and have continuously developed the brand since then.
- In 2022, we established Bricknic BV, which holds several patents and trademarks around our products
- We have successfully launched five Bricknic products and market them internationally.
- We have received various awards, such as the German Newcomer Design Award and the Red Dot Product Design Award.
- We have also established a fruitful partnership with Römertopf Keramik GMBH&KG.
- As CEO, I am responsible for setting both short-term and long-term goals for the company, managing the team, developing new products, driving sales, overseeing international shipping logistics, and developing the brand.
- Our office, design studio, and warehouse is located in Rotterdam, Netherlands.

Visit our Linktree to learn more: https://linktr.ee/bricknic.
profile_positions.title: Inventor, Co-founder, Ceo

profile_positions.description:
- As a member of the Design Network Hub, initiated by the German Design Museum Foundation, Design Association Kenya, German Design Council, and Federal Foreign Office Germany, I had the opportunity to connect with industry professionals and expand my knowledge in design in Kenya and Germany. 
- I collaborated with Geroge Wekesa and Marvin Kasper to develop a concept for a digital learning platform, aimed at providing access to design resources and skills for a global audience.
- The final concept was presented the concept at the Crossing Border Symposium in Berlin, an event that brought together experts in the field of design to share ideas and knowledge. 

https://www.design-networking-hub.com/
profile_positions.title: Design Fellow at Design Networking Hub

profile_positions.description:
- Completed a six-month residency with Cultureland.nl in Amsterdam, where I developed the foundation for the project "Tree-001.com."
- Conducted extensive research on ways for non-human entities to thrive in the digital world, which served as the basis for "Tree-001.com."
- Created a prototype for a live-streamed tree that can be viewed on the website "Tree-001.com".
- Started the collaboration with visual artist Sunjoo Lee to further develop "Tree-001,"
- Hosted an Instagram live presentation from the Amsterdam studio of Cultureland.nl during the Covid-19 lockdown. 
The "Tree-001.com" project is funded by Simuleringsfonds and was presented at the "In Real Live" panel talk at Mu Art Space in Einhoven, showcasing the project to a wider audience and sparking conversations about the potential of digital environments for non-human entities.

http://tree-001.com/ ——  https://cultureland.nl/
profile_positions.title: Designer in Residence

profile_positions.description:
- Participated in the first Geo Design Research exhibition by Design Academy Eindhoven, "GEO—DESIGN: Alibaba. From here to your home", curated by Joseph Grimy and Martina Mutzi.
- Conducted research on the social and economic implications of the growing e-commerce industry in Uganda, by following the value creation chain of common shoes manufactured in China and sold in Uganda.
- Interviewed experts within the value chain and set up an hybrid digital/physical street shoe shop as part of the exhibition setup.
- Presented research findings as a physical multimedia exhibition at the Van Abbe Museum and during the Salone del Mobile in Milan, effectively communicating the project's objectives and achievements.

https://geodesign.online/archive/projects/e-hustling-east-africa-online-with-alibabara
profile_positions.title: Research Designer - Geo Design - Alibaba. From here to your home.

company.name: Hivos - Humanist Organisation for Social Change

profile_positions.description:
- Successfully led the development and management of several projects, including the Osss (Open Source Snack System) - a concept that supports the diversification of indigenous crops in Uganda and Kenya.
- Initiated, designed and organised Greenobi, Nairobi’s first vegetarian rooftop popup restaurant, which utilized a self-developed solar cooker powered by the sun.
- Presented the solar cooker at the Nairobi Design Week 2019, showcasing its innovative approach to sustainable cooking.
- Received and managed a budget of 15,000€ as part of the Open Source Seed System Innovation Accelerator Programm, ensuring financial stability and maximising project impact.
- Conducted extensive research and field trips to Kenya and Uganda, engaging in meetings with partners on the ground to gain a deeper understanding of the project's potential impact.
- Developed a comprehensive project presentation and presented it to Hivos International in The Hague, clearly communicating the project's objectives and achievements.

https://hivos.org/program/open-source-seed-system/
profile_positions.title: Concept Designer

profile_positions.description:
- Completed a 6-month internship at early-stage startup company Guavay in Dar Es Salam, Tanzania, which is developing and producing organic fertiliser
- Acquired knowledge in creative business development through participating in brainstorming sessions with the founding team to shape business concepts
- Conducted field research on product quality in partnership with the University of Dar Es Salam
- Assisted the founder in meetings with potential funding partners and visits to production companies
- Contributed to the creation of marketing materials and participated in field trips to farmers communities to promote the product
- Involved in sales activities, including market and fair promotions.

https://www.hakikafertilizer.co.tz/
profile_positions.title: Designer - Creative Strategy

- Completed a three months internship at an architecture firm
- Gaining experience in technical drawing and floorplan creation
- Developed an understanding of spatial design 
- Introduction to project management tasks and responsibilities

http://bauquadrat.net/kontakt/
